intro: Periestes comorensis, commonly known as the Comorian spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Comoros archipelago. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are typically surrounded by colorful bracts. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in coastal and limestone areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
